","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T09:29:42.108Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":71.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492148,"topic_slug":"yagsl-turning-help","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67349,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-turning-help/492148/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3531322,"name":"Andrii Bessarab","username":"andriibessarab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andriibessarab/{size}/258546_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T12:17:32.288Z","cooked":"

Hey there!

It’s hard to pinpoint the exact issue from the Shuffleboard values alone. When I ran into issues with angle motors, I found FRC Web Components very helpful. It visualizes desired vs. acquired states, and it was instrumental in identifying and correcting inversions, which ultimately fixed our drive. Perhaps, give it a shot!

Also, I don’t know your swerve config, but perhaps you need to add swervedrive.pushOffsetsToControllers() to the constructor?

And lastly, have you set the gear ratio and conversion factors correctly?

adding swervedrive.pushOffsetsToControllers() causes the modules to spin uncontrollably. yes, the gear ratios and conversion factors are correct.

It seems that the angle value for neither FL motor nor BR motor match what measuredState shows. Do you mind expanding what measuredStates are as well as showing data for other modules.

A few other things:

  • Is your YAGSL up-to-date?—they had a version where azimuth motors would spin past desired states.
  • When you point your joystick in that direction, do the motors always end up in the same(or complementary) positions?
  • Is what shown in Advantage actually matches the physical position of the wheels?
  • Did you check that when you spin the wheel CCW both abs encoder and rel encoder values increase as well as in the Advantage—the wheel rotates ccw?

That is quite strange!

To clarify, when you say wheels end up in the same position, do you mean on the actual robot or in Advantage(because if I understood it right—those do not match)?

Do you mind listing your drive’s specifications, sort of like:

  • Modules: MK4i L2
  • Motors: Neo V1.1
  • Motor Controllers: Spark MAX
  • Absolute Encoders: CanCoder
  • IMU: Pigeon 2

And also do you have your code on some kind of remote VCS so i could view it?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T13:59:36.356Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":17,"readers_count":16,"score":8.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492148,"topic_slug":"yagsl-turning-help","display_username":"Andrii Bessarab","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67349,"username":"z4379x","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/9dc877/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4951 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-turning-help/492148/10","custom_user_title":"4951 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531432,"name":"Andrii Bessarab","username":"andriibessarab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andriibessarab/{size}/258546_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T14:46:57.665Z","cooked":"

I looked at the code. Let me know if I’m misunderstanding it.

The command that runs by default is drivebase.setDefaultCommand(driveRobotOrientedAngularVelocity).

But on the line Command driveRobotOrientedAngularVelocity = drivebase.driveFieldOriented(driveRobotOriented) you are using a field oriented command which “Drives the robot given a chassis field oriented velocity.”, but it seems you provide it with robot-oriented velocity instead?

In Advantage, if you are—in fact—driving field-oriented, in addition to desired states and measured states, you should feed it rotation (from the images above, it does not seem like it’s there).

In SwerveSubsystem, there is a method:

  /**
   * Drive according to the chassis robot oriented velocity.
   *
   * @param velocity Robot oriented {@link ChassisSpeeds}
   * @return 
   */
  public Command drive(ChassisSpeeds velocity)
  {
    return run(() -> swerveDrive.drive(velocity));
  }

Maybe, try using that or one of other drive commands instead. Here is the command my team used.

it works somewhat better in field oriented but it’s still off? somehow? how would be drive robot oriented though? because the command we were using was just there by default.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T15:14:18.463Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":17,"readers_count":16,"score":8.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492148,"topic_slug":"yagsl-turning-help","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":58460,"username":"andriibessarab","name":"Andrii Bessarab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andriibessarab/{size}/258546_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67349,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/yagsl-turning-help/492148/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531561,"name":"Andrii Bessarab","username":"andriibessarab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andriibessarab/{size}/258546_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T16:26:45.559Z","cooked":"

Try creating a command similar to ours:

  /**
   * Command to drive the robot using translative values and heading as angular velocity.
   *
   * @param translation             Translation in the X direction (forward).
   * @param translation             Translation in the Y direction (left).
   * @param angularRotationX        Rotation of the robot to set
   * @param fieldRelative           True if field relative, false if robot relative
   * @param openLoop                If true will use open-loop velocity(higher responsiveness - better for auton), else will use close-loop velocity(higher precision - better for teleop).
   *
   * @return Drive command.
   */
  public Command driveCommand(DoubleSupplier translationX, DoubleSupplier translationY, DoubleSupplier angularRotationX, boolean fieldRelative, boolean openLoop)
  {
    return run(() -> {
      // Make the robot drive
      swerveDrive.drive(
        new Translation2d(
          translationX.getAsDouble() * swerveDrive.getMaximumChassisVelocity(),
          translationY.getAsDouble() * swerveDrive.getMaximumChassisVelocity()
        ),
        angularRotationX.getAsDouble() * swerveDrive.getMaximumChassisAngularVelocity(),
        fieldRelative,
        openLoop);
    });
  }

And in RobotContainer:

    m_Swerve.setDefaultCommand(
      m_Swerve.driveCommand(
        () -> MathUtil.applyDeadband(m_DriverController.getLeftY() * -1, 0.1),
        () -> MathUtil.applyDeadband(m_DriverController.getLeftX() * -1, 0.1),
        () -> MathUtil.applyDeadband(m_DriverController.getRightX() * -1, 0.1) *0.7,
        false,
        false
      )
    );

The three suppliers are values from the controller in the range of -1 to 1 of three different axes, i.e., fwd, left, and ccw.

Try that and let me know if it helps!

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-18T16:27:24.108Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":18,"readers_count":17,"score":13.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492148,"topic_slug":"yagsl-turning-help","display_username":"Andrii Bessarab","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67349,"username":"z4379x","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/z/9dc877/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58460,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4951 Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-turning-help/492148/14","custom_user_title":"4951 Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3531618,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-18T17:11:37.481Z","cooked":"

They are using a custom swerve module with a gear ratio on the absolute encoder. Ontop of this the support for SRX Mag’s isnt very well fleshed out due to the lack of a userbase. We just debugged their problem in the YAGSL discord.

Their fixes were applied to a local copy in their code which does the following

  1. Applies a gear ratio to TalonSRXEncoderSwerve conversion factor.
  2. Fixes TalonSRXSwerve.setAbsoluteEncoder to set the boolean value based on the passed in absolute encoder type. (Upstreamed)
  3. Call SwerveDrive.useExternalFeedbackSensor to force the offset from the absolute encoder into the TalonSRX encoder offset as it appeared that the offset was not taken into account correctly without this.
